abstract: Some federal money is coming with a condition that smaller banks seek to merge with larger institutions.
snippet: Some federal money is coming with a condition that smaller banks seek to merge with larger institutions.
lead_paragraph: The government may view Bank of America and Citigroup as too big to fail, and dozens of smaller banks may soon find that size matters for them as well.

headline.main: Smaller Banks’ Losses Expected to Bring Mergers
headline.print_headline: Smaller Banks’ Losses Expected to Bring Mergers

abstract: John A. Thain, the former chief of Merrill Lynch, was said to no longer have the trust of the head of Bank of America.
snippet: John A. Thain, the former chief of Merrill Lynch, was said to no longer have the trust of the head of Bank of America.
lead_paragraph: His Wall Street pedigree seems impeccable. A top job at Goldman Sachs. The chief of the New York Stock Exchange. Finally, the reins of the stock market’s “thundering herd,” Merrill Lynch.

headline.main: Thain Resigns Amid Losses at Bank of America
headline.print_headline: A Charmed Wall Street Career Is Derailed at Bank of America

byline.original: By Julie Creswell and Louise Story

abstract: History cautions against a traditional lender buying an investment bank. Maybe Bank of America thought it was different this time.
snippet: History cautions against a traditional lender buying an investment bank. Maybe Bank of America thought it was different this time.
lead_paragraph: The history of finance is littered with disastrous tales of commercial banks acquiring their Wall Street cousins. In good times, the investment bankers with their Hermès ties often sell high, then wave goodbye to their unglamorous new owners. Merrill Lynch’s snookering of Bank of America seems to show it’s no different in bad times.

headline.main: A History Lesson With Merrill Deal
headline.print_headline: A History Lesson With Merrill Deal

abstract: The government may view Bank of America and Citigroup as too big to fail, and dozens of smaller banks may soon find that size matters for them as well.
lead_paragraph: The government may view Bank of America and Citigroup as too big to fail, and dozens of smaller banks may soon find that size matters for them as well.

headline.main: Smaller Banks’ Losses Apt to Bring Mergers

abstract: This last week has seen some blockbuster news in the form of Merrill Lynch/Bank of America, Steven P. Jobs/Apple and, of course, the inauguration of President Obama. In the wake of these stories, you might have missed some of the smaller occurrences of the week. So I thought I would bring you up to date. Nonetheless, I can’t resist starting with some brief thoughts on Bank of America and the continuing allegations of nondisclosure.
lead_paragraph: This last week has seen some blockbuster news in the form of Merrill Lynch/Bank of America, Steven P. Jobs/Apple and, of course, the inauguration of President Obama. In the wake of these stories, you might have missed some of the smaller occurrences of the week. So I thought I would bring you up to date. Nonetheless, I can’t resist starting with some brief thoughts on Bank of America and the continuing allegations of nondisclosure.

headline.main: Weekend Thoughts on Deals Big and Small

abstract: Bank of America has created an account on Twitter, the popular microblogging site, to interact with customers.
snippet: Bank of America has created an account on Twitter, the popular microblogging site, to interact with customers.
lead_paragraph: Jimmy Fallon, Shaquille O’Neal and Erykah Badu have all jumped on the Twitter bandwagon. Add to that list… Bank of America?

headline.main: Problems With Your Checking Account? Try Twitter
